turns.speaker: TOM
turns.text: Where did you get Pilgrim from?

turns.speaker: GRACE
turns.text: We bought him in Kentucky. My mother and I took a trip down there to see him.

turns.speaker: TOM
turns.text: That must have been pretty special.

turns.speaker: GRACE
turns.text: Are you afraid of anything?

turns.speaker: TOM
turns.text: Getting old. Not being of much use, I guess.  What went on out there, Grace? With Pilgrim?

turns.speaker: TOM
turns.text: I won't tell you it'll stop feeling this bad... But I can tell you, you didn't do anything wrong... The same thing would have happened to me... or Frank... or Joe... And there's no sense in looking for a reason why things happen...  I used to try and... always came up short. I don't think the why so's important as... what we do with what we get. I remember this boy I'd see up on the Blackfeet Reservation. He was sixteen. Great kid. Strong. He'd gone swimming and dived headfirst into a rock. Snapped his neck, paralyzed him... After the accident, I'd look in on him from time to time... and he wasn't there anymore. His mind, his spirit, whatever you want to call it, it just disappeared. And what was left was nothing but anger... It's like the boy I knew just went away somewhere...

turns.speaker: GRACE
turns.text: I know where he goes.

turns.speaker: TOM
turns.text: I know you do. Don't you disappear.  You do whatever you have to, to hold on...  I'll tell you one more thing... When Pilgrim reared up to face that truck... you know what I think?... I think that damn horse loved you so much, he was trying to protect you... That's what I think.

turns.speaker: GRACE
turns.text: I can't... not yet...

turns.speaker: TOM
turns.text: There's no hurry. Take you time.

turns.speaker: TOM
turns.text: Sure?

turns.speaker: GRACE
turns.text: Sure.

turns.speaker: TOM
turns.text: There's still something going on inside of him I can't reach. So me and Smokey here, we're going to try laying him down. Okay?

turns.speaker: GRACE
turns.text: What does that mean?

turns.speaker: TOM
turns.text: It's more or less how it sounds. Sometimes it's not pretty to watch. Some horses fight it real hard. Your fella's already shown us he likes a good fight. So if you don't want to watch, I'll call you when it's done.

turns.speaker: GRACE
turns.text: I want to watch.

turns.speaker: TOM
turns.text: Grace, I need you to come with me.

turns.speaker: GRACE
turns.text: No, you're only going to hurt him some more.

turns.speaker: TOM
turns.text: He's not hurt. He's okay. Look at him.

turns.speaker: GRACE
turns.text: No!

turns.speaker: TOM
turns.text: Grace, Listen... you've got to do this. Just trust me one more time.

turns.speaker: JUDITH
turns.text: It's warmer than I thought.

turns.speaker: GRACE
turns.text: You want to go to a movie tonight?

turns.speaker: JUDITH
turns.text: I thought your mom's coming up?

turns.speaker: GRACE
turns.text: So?

turns.speaker: JUDITH
turns.text: My parents are having friends from college over. They're really nice... They have this gorgeous son who wants to be a forest ranger.

turns.speaker: GRACE
turns.text: Can I come? I'll start a fire...

turns.speaker: GRACE
turns.text: ...Oh, come on! You think the same thing!

turns.speaker: JUDITH
turns.text: I just could never say it!

turns.speaker: GRACE
turns.text: Do you want to go around by the old road?

turns.speaker: JUDITH
turns.text: Why don't we just cut through the woods?

turns.speaker: GRACE
turns.text: You want to go down or stay along the river?

turns.speaker: JUDITH
turns.text: We already did the river. Let's go down and across the old bridge. We can circle back.

turns.speaker: JUDITH
turns.text: "... and I said that"...

turns.speaker: GRACE
turns.text: No, wait, it just goes... "he said he liked to do-"...

turns.speaker: GRACE
turns.text: Jude, you okay?

turns.speaker: JUDITH
turns.text: I'm okay... I'm okay.

turns.speaker: GRACE
turns.text: Have you heard from Judith's parents?

turns.speaker: ROBERT
turns.text: No, not yet.

turns.speaker: GRACE
turns.text: How's Pilgrim doing?

turns.speaker: GRACE
turns.text: Dad! I can do it, OK?!

turns.speaker: ROBERT
turns.text: OK, OK.

turns.speaker: ROBERT
turns.text: Do you want something else, honey? We order something else?

turns.speaker: GRACE
turns.text: No, I'm just not that hungry.

turns.speaker: ROBERT
turns.text: You want to watch some television?

turns.speaker: GRACE
turns.text: Maybe... look -- just...

turns.speaker: ROBERT
turns.text: Honey, you all right? Did something fall?

turns.speaker: GRACE
turns.text: NO!

turns.speaker: ROBERT
turns.text: What, sweetheart?

turns.speaker: GRACE
turns.text: I want to see Pilgrim.

turns.speaker: GRACE
turns.text: Did you notice -- no cane?

turns.speaker: ROBERT
turns.text: I know. Amazing.

turns.speaker: GRACE
turns.text: Can we show him Pilgrim, Tom?

turns.speaker: ROBERT
turns.text: Shouldn't we have invited Tom over?

turns.speaker: GRACE
turns.text: I did. He said he had work to do until late.

turns.speaker: TWIN
turns.text: IT WAS MY TURN!

turns.speaker: JOE
turns.text: YA JUST HAD A TURN. IT WAS NOT.

turns.speaker: TWIN
turns.text: WAS SO!

turns.speaker: JOE
turns.text: Don't be such a baby!

turns.speaker: TWIN
turns.text: You just showing off for her!

turns.speaker: JOE
turns.text: You shut up, stupid!

turns.speaker: TWIN
turns.text: You're the one who's stupid -- letting her go and fall off your horse!!

turns.speaker: ROBERT
turns.text: Hi. It's a pleasure. I'm very grateful for the way you took in my girls here. I bet you were surprised when they just showed up out of nowhere.

turns.speaker: TOM
turns.text: Oh yeah...

turns.speaker: ROBERT
turns.text: I can't believe it's the same horse.

turns.speaker: TOM
turns.text: We still have a way to go.

turns.speaker: ROBERT
turns.text: How much longer do you think?

turns.speaker: TOM
turns.text: Well, like I told your wife, it's really up to Pilgrim.

turns.speaker: ROBERT
turns.text: I understand...

turns.speaker: TOM
turns.text: Is the poverty worse, now, you think?

turns.speaker: ROBERT
turns.text: I haven't been back in over twenty years, but I wouldn't be surprised. The population's larger.

turns.speaker: RONA
turns.text: Hey, darlin'.

turns.speaker: TOM
turns.text: Hey, Rona. Sorry I'm late.

turns.speaker: RONA
turns.text: I wouldn't know what to do if you were on time.

turns.speaker: TOM
turns.text: You're looking fit.

turns.speaker: RONA
turns.text: Fit? You want to check my teeth.  Good crowd today. I think you'll have some fun. You going to stay for dinner?

turns.speaker: TOM
turns.text: If it's not too much trouble, I thought I might.

turns.speaker: RONA
turns.text: Kind of trouble I'm in the mood for.

turns.speaker: TOM
turns.text: Oh-oh... Maybe I better get back in the truck.

turns.speaker: RONA
turns.text: Oh I clear forget. You had a call from some woman in New York. She sounded pretty wound up.

turns.speaker: TOM
turns.text: I don't any woman in New York. But from what I hear, most of them are wound up.

turns.speaker: RONA
turns.text: The number's by the phone.

turns.speaker: RONA
turns.text: What are you looking at, young man?

turns.speaker: TOM
turns.text: How long were you married?

turns.speaker: RONA
turns.text: Long enough.

turns.speaker: TOM
turns.text: You ever miss it?

turns.speaker: RONA
turns.text: Does a horse miss a saddle?

turns.speaker: TOM
turns.text: Sometimes.

turns.speaker: TOM
turns.text: You know, Rona, we weren't all that good together even when we were good together.

turns.speaker: RONA
turns.text: Honey... I was always good.

turns.speaker: TOM
turns.text: Well, that'll happen.

turns.speaker: WOMAN
turns.text: Where did you learn all this stuff?

turns.speaker: TOM
turns.text: What stuff is that?

turns.speaker: WOMAN
turns.text: About horses? I'd love to learn more about it myself. Do you offer any private lessons for riders?

turns.speaker: TOM
turns.text: Well... Dale... you know, a lot of this stuff... it just... nuts and bolts.

turns.speaker: WOMAN
turns.text: What do you mean?

turns.speaker: TOM
turns.text: Well, if the rider's nuts, the horse bolts.  That's the whole lesson right there. You have a good day now... Just... keep on freeing yourself up.

turns.speaker: AGENT BOB
turns.text: Listen to this bullshit.  "This is our world now. The world of the electron and the switch, the beauty of the baud. We exist without nationality, skin color, or religious bias. You wage wars, murder, cheat, lie to us and try to make us believe it's for our own good, yet we're the criminals. Yes, I am a criminal. My crime is that of curiosity. I am a hacker and this is my manifesto." Huh, right, manifesto? "You may stop me, but you can't stop us all."

turns.speaker: AGENT RAY
turns.text: Now that's cool.

turns.speaker: AGENT BOB
turns.text: Cool?

turns.speaker: AGENT RAY
turns.text: Yeah, cool.

turns.speaker: AGENT BOB
turns.text: You think it's cool?

turns.speaker: AGENT RAY
turns.text: It's cool!

turns.speaker: AGENT BOB
turns.text: It's not cool. It's commie bullshit!

turns.speaker: AGENT RAY
turns.text: Secret Service!

turns.speaker: AGENT BOB
turns.text: Don't move!

turns.speaker: GILL
turns.text: How's it going, Ray?

turns.speaker: AGENT RAY
turns.text: It looks good, sir. We've got an uncorrupted hard drive.

turns.speaker: GILL
turns.text: In English, please. I didn't spend ten years protecting the president so I could finish my career feeling like an idiot.

turns.speaker: AGENT RAY
turns.text: I'm sorry, sir. We caught him by surprise, so we don't think he had time to erase his computer files.

turns.speaker: GILL
turns.text: Good. Good man. Alright, let's finish up here, and take him in for interrogation.

turns.speaker: AGENT RAY
turns.text: Alright sir.

turns.speaker: RAZOR
turns.text: Welcome to our show!

turns.speaker: BLADE
turns.text: Hack the Planet!

turns.speaker: BLADE
turns.text: As you can see, this is just a simple microcassette recorder.   Hook it up to the phone and drop in five bucks in quarters.

turns.speaker: RAZOR
turns.text: Record the tones that the coins make. And hang up and get your money back!

turns.speaker: BLADE
turns.text: And never again have to pay for a service that would be dirt cheap...

turns.speaker: RAZOR
turns.text: ...IF it weren't run by a bunch of profiteering gluttons!

turns.speaker: BLADE
turns.text: Remember, hacking is more than just a crime. It's a survival trait!

turns.speaker: BLADE
turns.text: Let's keep her.

turns.speaker: RAZOR
turns.text: Waste the dude.

turns.speaker: RAZOR
turns.text: She's rabid, but cute.

turns.speaker: BLADE
turns.text: See, we're very busy. A TV network that wishes to remain nameless has expressed an interest in our show.

turns.speaker: BLADE
turns.text: That's it! An electronic army! If I were us, I'd get on the internet, send out a major distress signal.

turns.speaker: RAZOR
turns.text: Hackers of the World, Unite!

turns.speaker: BLADE
turns.text: How are you going to take care of the cops?

turns.speaker: CEREAL
turns.text: What's that?

turns.speaker: DADE
turns.text: Devil book. The Unix Bible.

turns.speaker: CEREAL
turns.text: What's that?

turns.speaker: DADE
turns.text: Dragon book. Compiler design.

turns.speaker: CEREAL
turns.text: Oh yeah? What's that?

turns.speaker: DADE
turns.text: The Red Book. NSA Trusted Networks. Otherwise known as the Ugly Red Book that won't fit on a shelf.

turns.speaker: DADE
turns.text: Maybe. But, if I were gonna hack some heavy metal, I'd, uh, work my way back through some low security, and try the back door.

turns.speaker: CEREAL
turns.text: Yeah but oh man,  wouldn't you just love to get one of those Gibsons, baby? Ooooh!

turns.speaker: CEREAL
turns.text: So what do you think, can I crash at your place tonight?

turns.speaker: DADE
turns.text: What is it with this guy?

turns.speaker: DADE
turns.text: Shit!

turns.speaker: CEREAL
turns.text: Shh!

turns.speaker: DADE
turns.text: Was that her top?

turns.speaker: CEREAL
turns.text: Right.

turns.speaker: DADE
turns.text: The sensitive type.

turns.speaker: DADE
turns.text: I can't. Everybody who touches that thing gets busted, I can't afford to get arrested, I'm sorry.

turns.speaker: CEREAL
turns.text: Maybe I should just go to the bathroom or something.

turns.speaker: DADE
turns.text: What?

turns.speaker: CEREAL
turns.text: Check this out. It's a memo about how they're gonna deal with those oil spills that happened on the fourteenth.

turns.speaker: CEREAL
turns.text: Uh... Nikon, can I... can I crash at your place tonight?

turns.speaker: NIKON
turns.text: Again?  Yeah sure.

turns.speaker: CEREAL
turns.text: Active matrix, man. A million psychedelic colors. Man, baby, sweet, ooo!

turns.speaker: NIKON
turns.text: I want it.

turns.speaker: NIKON
turns.text: Very impressive.

turns.speaker: CEREAL
turns.text: Super hero like even.

turns.speaker: CEREAL
turns.text: Hold on a second!

turns.speaker: NIKON
turns.text: Look at this, it's so lean and clean.

turns.speaker: CEREAL
turns.text: Looks like a hacker wrote it.

turns.speaker: CEREAL
turns.text: Oh man. That's universally stupid, man!

turns.speaker: NIKON
turns.text: Yo, man, you an amateur, man.

turns.speaker: NIKON
turns.text: Biggest crash in history, front page, New York Times, August 10th, 1988. I thought you was black, man! Yo, man, this is Zero Cool! Oh, shit!

turns.speaker: CEREAL
turns.text: That's far out!

turns.speaker: NIKON
turns.text: This is Zero Cool, man! Whooo, haha!

turns.speaker: CEREAL
turns.text: Ta-da!

turns.speaker: NIKON
turns.text: Yo, brain dead, the manual!

turns.speaker: CEREAL
turns.text: Snoop onto them...

turns.speaker: NIKON
turns.text: ...as they snoop onto us.

turns.speaker: NIKON
turns.text: Well, I got a lot, alright? I don't know how many but... my head hurts.

turns.speaker: CEREAL
turns.text: Yo, everyone check this out. Hey, what's the Da Vinci virus?

turns.speaker: NIKON
turns.text: Damn!

turns.speaker: CEREAL
turns.text: A worm AND a virus? The plot thickens.

turns.speaker: CEREAL
turns.text: ...and your name goes through like seventeen computers a day. 1984, yeah right man, that's a typo. Orwell's here and now, he's living large. We have no names, man, no names. We are nameless. Can I score a fry? Thanks.

turns.speaker: PHREAK
turns.text: Meet Cereal Killer. As in Froot Loops? But he does know things.

turns.speaker: PHREAK
turns.text: What are you, stoned or stupid? You don't hack a bank across state lines from your house, you'll get nailed by the FBI. Where are your brains, in your ass? Don't you know anything?

turns.speaker: CEREAL
turns.text: Stupid, man. It's universally stupid.

turns.speaker: CEREAL
turns.text: Yeah but don't forget God. System operators love to use God. It's that whole male ego thing.

turns.speaker: PHREAK
turns.text: Look, you wanna be elite? You gotta do a righteous hack. None of this accidental shit.

turns.speaker: CEREAL
turns.text: Oh yeah, you want a seriously righteous hack, you score one of those Gibsons man. You know, supercomputers they use to like, do physics, and look for oil and stuff?

turns.speaker: PHREAK
turns.text: Ain't no way, man, security's too tight. The big iron?

turns.speaker: PHREAK
turns.text: Cereal, man, you owe me a pack.

turns.speaker: CEREAL
turns.text: It was him, man!

turns.speaker: PHREAK
turns.text: You're psyched. You need to lay off of that shit.

turns.speaker: CEREAL
turns.text: I'm gonna hit you!

turns.speaker: PHREAK
turns.text: His parents missed Woodstock and he's been making up for it since. Hey, you hear about Joey's bust?

turns.speaker: CEREAL
turns.text: Yeah. Probably had something to do with that bank in Idaho.

turns.speaker: PHREAK
turns.text: Do you think he could hack a Gibson?

turns.speaker: PHREAK
turns.text: I want it to have my children!

turns.speaker: CEREAL
turns.text: Yeah, I bet it looks crispy in the dark.

turns.speaker: PHREAK
turns.text: Yo, hit the lights.

turns.speaker: PHREAK
turns.text: One-handed!

turns.speaker: CEREAL
turns.text: Difficulty rating?

turns.speaker: CEREAL
turns.text: Nonononono. Truce, you guys. Listen, we got a higher purpose here, alright? A wake up call for the Nintendo Generation. We demand free access to data, well, it comes with some responsibility. When I was a child, I spake as a child, I understood as a child, I thought as a child, but when I became a man I put away childish things.  What... It's Corinthians I, Chapter 13, verse 11, no duh. Come on.

turns.speaker: KATE
turns.text: Phreak and Joey are being framed. We need your help to figure out what's on this disc.

turns.speaker: CEREAL
turns.text: Oh wow, we are fried.

turns.speaker: KATE
turns.text: Never send a boy to do a woman's job. With me, we can do it in seven.

turns.speaker: CEREAL
turns.text: You're both screwed. I help, we can do it in six.

turns.speaker: CEREAL
turns.text: Well this hasn't happened yet.

turns.speaker: KATE
turns.text: Wait a minute, the fourteenth, that's the same day the worm ends its run.  I mean... Da Vinci virus, didn't Phreak say that's what he was being charged with? Look...  "Infecting ballast programs of Ellingson tankers" - they blame hackers!

turns.speaker: CEREAL
turns.text: Ai! Boom boom aiaiaiaiaee! Alright, that was a little tension breaker, that had to be done, alright?

turns.speaker: KATE
turns.text: Cereal.

turns.speaker: CEREAL
turns.text: Yeah?

turns.speaker: KATE
turns.text: Go fix the phones.

turns.speaker: CEREAL
turns.text: Roger.

turns.speaker: DADE
turns.text: Who's that?

turns.speaker: PHREAK
turns.text: Curtis.

turns.speaker: DADE
turns.text: And what's he do?

turns.speaker: PHREAK
turns.text: That's it, you're looking at it, he just looks slick all day.

turns.speaker: DADE
turns.text: You heard of a hacker called Acid Burn? You know who he is?

turns.speaker: PHREAK
turns.text: No, don't know who he is.  Do you?

turns.speaker: DADE
turns.text: Did you talk to him?

turns.speaker: PHREAK
turns.text: Nope. His mom said he's grounded for his next three lifetimes.  He isn't to consort with his computer friends.  The secret service is really out to get him.  Hey there's a big party tonight, you wanna go?

turns.speaker: PHREAK
turns.text: Yo. Check this out guys, this is insanely great, it's got a 28.8 BPS modem!

turns.speaker: DADE
turns.text: Yeah? Display?

turns.speaker: DADE
turns.text: Dead.

turns.speaker: PHREAK
turns.text: Dead?

turns.speaker: DADE
turns.text: Yeah. Like Rigor Mortis, Habeas Corpus.

turns.speaker: PHREAK
turns.text: Due to Mr. Gill's untimely demise and everything, I guess you two will have to improvise the next round.

turns.speaker: DADE
turns.text: Right. If I win, you wear a dress on our date.

turns.speaker: MRS. MURPHY
turns.text: Dade?

turns.speaker: DADE
turns.text: Yeah, mom?

turns.speaker: MRS. MURPHY
turns.text: What are you doing?

turns.speaker: DADE
turns.text: I'm taking over a TV network.

turns.speaker: MRS. MURPHY
turns.text: Finish up, honey, and get to sleep. And happy birthday.

turns.speaker: MRS. MURPHY
turns.text: Good morning. You unpack your stuff yet?

turns.speaker: DADE
turns.text: Mm-hmm.

turns.speaker: MRS. MURPHY
turns.text: Up all night again, huh?

turns.speaker: DADE
turns.text: Can this wait until both my eyes are open, please?

turns.speaker: MRS. MURPHY
turns.text: Can I cut the electricity to his room so he'll sleep normal hours? He's been playing with his computer all night for a solid week.  Well yes, he could be playing with himself. Mmm hmm. Yes I'll ask. Dade, you like girls, don't you?

turns.speaker: DADE
turns.text: Well, yeah, I just haven't found one as charming as you yet.

turns.speaker: MRS. MURPHY
turns.text: You haven't been doing anything stupid, right, Dade?  Right, Dade?!

turns.speaker: DADE
turns.text: Right, mom. And I'm still a virgin!

turns.speaker: MRS. MURPHY
turns.text: How was school?

turns.speaker: DADE
turns.text: Hmmm.

turns.speaker: MRS. MURPHY
turns.text: What did we learn in school today?

turns.speaker: DADE
turns.text: Revenge.

turns.speaker: MRS. MURPHY
turns.text: Aaaah. Did we meet someone special?

turns.speaker: DADE
turns.text: No. No one special.

turns.speaker: MRS. MURPHY
turns.text: Okay, I gotta get back to work. I'm gonna be home late.  And would you try and please fill these out?

turns.speaker: DADE
turns.text: Right. Anything else, you want me to mow the lawn? Oops, forgot. New York. No grass.

turns.speaker: MRS. MURPHY
turns.text: And unpack.

turns.speaker: PLAGUE
turns.text: Loser.  I can't believe you were only eleven when you wrote this. It's quite an impressive virus. Dade, I know how you might feel about narking on your friends, but, we're hackers. For us, there's no such thing as family and friends. We're each our own country, with temporary allies and enemies. I'd like to make a treaty with you.

turns.speaker: DADE
turns.text: I'm sorry. Who are you?

turns.speaker: PLAGUE
turns.text: I'm the one who understands you. Now, can we be allies?

turns.speaker: DADE
turns.text: Nah. I don't play well with others.

turns.speaker: DADE
turns.text: Shit! Come on!

turns.speaker: PLAGUE
turns.text: Watch which friends you do play with. A record like yours could land you in jail, get you kicked out of school, no colleges would take you. No future. Exiled from everyone and everything you love.

turns.speaker: PLAGUE
turns.text: I'm fine.  Oh, and Dade, try to stay out of trouble, okay?

turns.speaker: DADE
turns.text: Blow me.

turns.speaker: PLAGUE
turns.text: Thank you!

turns.speaker: PLAGUE
turns.text: The girl. The girl has the disc I need.

turns.speaker: DADE
turns.text: I told you, I don't play well with others.

turns.speaker: PLAGUE
turns.text: Turn on your laptop. Set it to receive a file.

turns.speaker: PLAGUE
turns.text: Lauren Murphy is now a wanted felon in the state of Washington. Forgery, Embezzlement, two drug convictions, plus she jumped parole. When she's arrested, she will not have a trial, she will not pass go, she will go directly to jail. Then I change this file back to the original, and your mom disappears.

turns.speaker: DADE
turns.text: That's bullshit.

turns.speaker: PLAGUE
turns.text: What can I tell you. Computers never lie, kid. Your mom will be arrested at work, she'll be handcuffed, and later, strip searched.

turns.speaker: DADE
turns.text: You lay a finger on her and I'll kill you.

turns.speaker: PLAGUE
turns.text: Kid, don't threaten me. There are worse things than death and, uh, I can do all of them!

turns.speaker: PLAGUE
turns.text: Talk to me.

turns.speaker: DADE
turns.text: I got it. But listen, Kate didn't know what's on it. I mean, she came to me to figure it out. She's not the one who planted the virus. You leave her alone.

turns.speaker: PLAGUE
turns.text: Hey, don't worry, kid. If she's innocent, she'll be fine. Your mommy's safe now, okay?

turns.speaker: PLAGUE
turns.text: Game's over. Last chance to get out of this without a prison sentence.  You're not good enough to beat me, you little shit.

turns.speaker: DADE
turns.text: Yeah, maybe I'm not. But we are, you asshole.

turns.speaker: PLAGUE
turns.text: Give it up! Just give it up.

turns.speaker: DADE
turns.text: I found it! I found it!

turns.speaker: PLAGUE
turns.text: This is the end, my friend.  Thank you for calling!

turns.speaker: DADE
turns.text: Crash Override.

turns.speaker: NIKON
turns.text: Never heard of you. Done anything?

turns.speaker: DADE
turns.text: No.

turns.speaker: NIKON
turns.text: Yo, showtime, showtime!

turns.speaker: DADE
turns.text: What's going on?

turns.speaker: NIKON
turns.text: That's Razor and Blade.

turns.speaker: DADE
turns.text: Razor and Blade.

turns.speaker: NIKON
turns.text: Look out, man. Lisa Blair, 26 East 7th St., apartment 16, 555-4817, BOOM!

turns.speaker: DADE
turns.text: How did you know that?

turns.speaker: NIKON
turns.text: I got photographic memory.  It's a curse!  Lisa!

turns.speaker: NIKON
turns.text: Seven. Wow! Burn's wetware matches her software!

turns.speaker: DADE
turns.text: Burn!

turns.speaker: DADE
turns.text: This isn't a virus. It's a worm!

turns.speaker: NIKON
turns.text: What's this one eat?

turns.speaker: DADE
turns.text: It nibbles. You see this?

turns.speaker: NIKON
turns.text: Two days.

turns.speaker: DADE
turns.text: And judging by this segment alone, it's already eaten about...

turns.speaker: NIKON
turns.text: They'll trace you like that  man, cops are gonna find you, they're gonna find you with a smoking gun.

turns.speaker: DADE
turns.text: Fucked if I care, man.

turns.speaker: NIKON
turns.text: Look, even if you had the passwords, it'll take you ten minutes to get in, and you've still gotta find the files, man, I mean, the cops will have you in... five minutes.

turns.speaker: NIKON
turns.text: Jesus, I gotta save all your asses. I help, we can do it in five minutes, man.

turns.speaker: DADE
turns.text: Okay. Let's go shopping.
